attributes.action: To make free-from food available at service stations and airports in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
This is vital as this group of people in particular has no choice but to avoid this food as it will make them extremely unwell. As someone with Celiac disease, I find it extremely difficult to find any food such as sandwiches, wraps, and pasta pots at an airport or a service station.
We could go to a doctor, get a "Medical food" note and pre-buy our food, but why should we have to do that when people without an intolerance or allergies have it all conveniently in front of them with no worries?
attributes.background: Free-from food needs to be available for all people with allergies and an intolerance to foods such as milk, eggs, wheat, nuts, etc. when traveling in the UK.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about about what food to sell are a matter for individual businesses, including those located at service stations and airports, not the UK Government or Parliament.
